briefdescription.para: Flag for checking if regex_posix has already been included.

detaileddescription.para:
Create a regex from a character array. Adapted from https://www.lemoda.net/c/unix-regex/
r
pointer to regex_t. Resutling regex expression.
regex_text
constant character pointer to text that should be compiled.
static int Success or failure of compilation.

briefdescription.para: Count the number of times a regular expression is matched in a string.

parameterdescription.para: constant character pointer to string that should be compiled into a regex.
constant character pointer to string that should be checked for matches.

simplesect.para: int Number of matches found. -1 is returned if the regex could not be compiled.

parameterdescription.para: constant character pointer to string that should be compiled into a regex.
constant character pointer to string that should be checked for matches.
size_t index where match begins.
size_t index where match ends.

simplesect.para: int Number of matches found. -1 is returned if the regex could not be compiled.

briefdescription.para: Find first match to regex and any sub-matches.

parameterdescription.para: constant character pointer to string that should be compiled into a regex.
constant character pointer to string that should be checked for matches.
size_t ** indices of where matches begin.
size_t ** indices of where matches ends.

simplesect.para: int Number of matches/submatches found. -1 is returned if the regex could not be compiled.

memberdef.argsstring: (char *buf, const size_t len_buf, const char *re, const char *rp, const size_t nreplace)
memberdef.name: regex_replace_nosub

briefdescription.para: Make a replacement of regex matches, ignoring captured substrings.

parameterdescription.para: Characer pointer to buffer that replacements should be made to.
const size_t length of buf.
Constant character pointer to regex string.
Constant character pointer to the replacement text.
Constant size_t number of replacements to make. If 0, all matches are replaced.

simplesect.para: int -1 on failure if the regex could not be compiled or the buffer is not big enough to contain the result. If succesful, the new length of buf is returned.

briefdescription.para: Extract substring references from a string.

parameterdescription.para: Constant character pointer to buffer that references should be extracted from.
Pointer to pointer to memory where reference numbers should be stored. This function will reallocate it to fit the number of references returned. (Should be freed by calling program.)

simplesect.para: int Number of refs found. -1 indicates an error.

memberdef.argsstring: (char *buf, const size_t len_buf, const char *re, const char *rp, const size_t nreplace)
memberdef.name: regex_replace_sub

briefdescription.para: Make a replacement of regex matches, allowing for captured substrings.

parameterdescription.para: Characer pointer to buffer that replacements should be made to.
const size_t length of buf.
Constant character pointer to regex string.
Constant character pointer to the replacement text.
Constant size_t number of replacements to make. If 0, all matches are replaced.

simplesect.para: int -1 on failure if the regex could not be compiled or the buffer is not big enough to contain the result. If succesful, the new length of buf is returned.
